comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Isidore Auguste Marie Louis Paulhan, known as Louis Paulhan, (19 July 1883, Pézenas, Hérault – 10 February 1963, Saint-Jean-de-Luz)[1] was a pioneering French aviator who in 1910 flew "Le Canard", the world's first seaplane, designed by Henri Fabre. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louis_Paulhan
